docs.snippet: Striker Diego Forlán scored twice as Uruguay knocked host Venezuela out of the Copa América with a 4-1 victory in a quarterfinal in San Cristobal. Uruguay advanced to a semifinal game against Brazil, which routed Chile, 6-1, in Puerto La Cruz.
docs.lead_paragraph: Striker Diego Forlán scored twice as Uruguay knocked host Venezuela out of the Copa América with a 4-1 victory in a quarterfinal in San Cristobal. Uruguay advanced to a semifinal game against Brazil, which routed Chile, 6-1, in Puerto La Cruz.
docs.abstract: Uruguay defeats Venezuela, 4-1, in Copa America (S)

docs.snippet: Olympics     NO PLACE FOR U.S. ON I.O.C. BOARD  Anita DeFrantz finished a distant last yesterday in an election for a seat on the International Olympic Committee's executive board, leaving the United States again without a seat on the Olympics' most...
docs.lead_paragraph: Olympics NO PLACE FOR U.S. ON I.O.C. BOARD Anita DeFrantz finished a distant last yesterday in an election for a seat on the International Olympic Committee's executive board, leaving the United States again without a seat on the Olympics' most influential body.

docs.snippet: Juan Roman Riquelme scored twice as Argentina beat Peru 4-0 to set up a Copa America semifinal against Mexico, which earlier routed 10-man Paraguay 6-0.
docs.lead_paragraph: Juan Roman Riquelme scored twice as Argentina beat Peru 4-0 to set up a Copa America semifinal against Mexico, which earlier routed 10-man Paraguay 6-0.

headline.main: Argentina, Mexico Enjoy Routs to Set Up Copa America Semifinal

docs.snippet: Join us later today for the last two quarterfinals at this Copa América: Mexico-Paraguay at 4 p.m., Eastern time, and Argentina-Peru at 7 p.m.
docs.lead_paragraph: Join us later today for the last two quarterfinals at this Copa América: Mexico-Paraguay at 4 p.m., Eastern time, and Argentina-Peru at 7 p.m. Jeff Z. Klein and Duncan Irving will bring you their commentary of the matches, LIVE, as they happen -- El Tri vs. los Guaraníes at the Estadio Monumental de Maturín in Maturín, and Chés vs. Incas at the Estadio Metropolitano de Fútbol de Lara in Barquisimeto.

docs.snippet: Hello everyone and welcome to our continuing coverage of the Copa America.

docs.snippet: Nery Castillo scored twice as Mexico hammered Paraguay, 6-0, yesterday in their Copa América quarterfinal in Maturin, Venezuela. Mexico handed Paraguay its worst defeat since 1980, when it lost by the same score to Brazil. Mexico advanced to a...
docs.lead_paragraph: Nery Castillo scored twice as Mexico hammered Paraguay, 6-0, yesterday in their Copa América quarterfinal in Maturin, Venezuela. Mexico handed Paraguay its worst defeat since 1980, when it lost by the same score to Brazil. Mexico advanced to a semifinal game Wednesday against the tournament favorite Argentina, which defeated Peru yesterday, 4-0. Brazil plays Uruguay tomorrow in the other semifinal.

docs.lead_paragraph: Nery Castillo scored twice as Mexico hammered Paraguay, 6-0, yesterday in their Copa América quarterfinal in Maturin, Venezuela. Mexico handed Paraguay its worst defeat since 1980, when it lost by the same score to Brazil. Mexico advanced to a semifinal game Wednesday against the tournament favorite Argentina, which defeated Peru yesterday, 4-0. Brazil plays Uruguay tomorrow in the other semifinal.

docs.snippet: A highlight reel of the Young Americans' first three games at the tournament, a Freddy Adu compilation reel -- and a video by Jojo.
docs.lead_paragraph: In case you're not quite up to speed on how the US sub-20 team have done so far at the FIFA U-20 World Championship, here's something to study as part of the run-up to Wednesday's USA-Uruguay match in Toronto (which we'll bring to you live on this blog at 6:45 p.m. Eastern time): a highlight reel of the Young Americans' first three games at the tournament.
docs.abstract: A highlight reel of the Young Americans' first three games at the tournament, a Freddy Adu compilation reel -- and a video by Jojo.

docs.snippet: The United States showed flashes of ordinary greatness while finishing first in Group D. Uruguay (1-1-1, third place in Group B) limps into the second round.
docs.lead_paragraph: It takes a certain sense of the ridiculous to think, never mind write, that the United States has a clear and attainable path to the semifinals of the FIFA U-20 World Cup in Canada. That, however, is the case as the American team plays Uruguay in the second round of the well-attended tournament, with the winner advancing to a quarterfinal match against either Austria or Gambia in Toronto on Saturday.
docs.abstract: The United States showed flashes of ordinary greatness while finishing first in Group D. Uruguay (1-1-1, third place in Group B) limps into the second round.

headline.main: U-20's: USA vs. Uruguay - the Preview
